subject: Physical Fitness
title: The Oxygen Demand
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Oxygen Demand.

hook.text: At rest you breathe about 12 times a minute. During intense exercise, that triples. Your body craves oxygen.

buildup.text: Working muscles need 15â€“25 times more oxygen than resting ones. Your lungs and heart must keep up.

discovery.text: VO2 max measures your body's peak oxygen use. Elite athletes hit 80+. Average adults reach about 35.

twist.text: You can't just breathe harder. The bottleneck is your heart's pumping power, not your lung size.

climax.text: Training improves oxygen delivery at every step â€” bigger stroke volume, denser capillary networks.

punchline.text: Fitness is how well your body moves oxygen from air to muscle.
